definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: The calm when the blue-black couplet letting a person like ink remembers copy calligraphy and unruffled .
sentences.chinese: 墨水般的深藍色讓人聯想起臨摹書法時的平靜和安詳。

sentences.english: The seashore remind me many hapiness of my childhood.
sentences.chinese: 海濱使我聯想起童年假期的各種愉快情景。

sentences.english: Darker purples can conjure gloominess and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 暗紫色使人聯想起憂鬱和悲傷。

sentences.english: The seashore reminds me many joyful scenes of my vacation in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 海濱使我聯想起童年假期的各種愉快情景。

sentences.english: These pictures are reminiscent of my late father.
sentences.chinese: 這些照片使我聯想起我的亡父。

sentences.english: Which brings me to the case of the collapsing crisis commission.
sentences.chinese: 這讓我聯想起了正在分崩離析的危機委員會。

sentences.english: This mishap reminded me of a traffic accident I once experienced.
sentences.chinese: 這次不幸事故使我聯想起我過去經歷的一次交通事故。

sentences.english: Controlled the air conditioning button which on the stage arranged in turn to let me associate the candied fruit.
sentences.chinese: 中控臺上依次排列的空調按鈕讓我聯想起了糖葫蘆。

sentences.english: She reminds me of a Barbie doll.
sentences.chinese: 她讓我聯想起芭比娃娃。

sentences.english: Locust trees in the north, is a reminiscent of the autumn decoration.
sentences.chinese: 北國的槐樹，也是一種能使人聯想起秋來的點綴。

sentences.english: One usually associates poverty with misery.
sentences.chinese: 人們一說到貧窮，常常就聯想起悲慘的境遇。
